Tao }}</ref> The company specializes in the development of autonomous case-handling robotic (ACR) systems,<ref>{{cite web | last=Straight | first=Brian | title=Warehouse automation firm Hai Robotics closes $100M series D funding round | work=FreightWaves | date=June 15, 2022 | url=https://www.freightwaves.com/news/warehouse-automation-firm-hai-robotics-closes-100m-series-d-funding-round | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230619171958/https://www.freightwaves.com/news/warehouse-automation-firm-hai-robotics-closes-100m-series-d-funding-round | archive-date=June 19, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> and is a member of MHI.<ref>{{cite web | author=MMH Staff | title=MHI welcomes 75 new member companies | work=[[Supply Chain Management Review]] | date=December 19, 2019 | url=https://www.scmr.com/article/mhi_welcomes_75_new_member_companies | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230620073949/https://www.scmr.com/article/mhi_welcomes_75_new_member_companies | archive-date=June 20, 2023 | url-status=live | ISSN=1521-9747 }}</ref> After its formation, the firm was funded by [[Sequoia Capital]],<ref>{{cite web | author=Brian Heater | title=Funding the robot revolution | work=[[Yahoo News]] | date=June 17, 2022 | url=https://au.news.yahoo.com/funding-robot-revolution-183003683.html | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230807055346/https://au.news.yahoo.com/funding-robot-revolution-183003683.html | archive-date=August 7, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> Walden International,<ref>{{cite web | author=Brian Heater | title=Attack of the $200M robotic raises | work=[[TechCrunch]] | date=September 23, 2021 | url=https://techcrunch.com/2021/09/23/attack-of-the-200m-robotic-raises/ }}</ref> Legend Star,<ref>{{cite web | title=Warehouse robotics startup Hai Robotics raises $200 million in funding | work=[[MENAFN]] | publisher=Robotics & Automation News | date=September 22, 2021 | url=https://menafn.com/1102841817/Warehouse-robotics-startup-Hai-Robotics-raises-200-million-in-funding | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230620132624/https://menafn.com/1102841817/Warehouse-robotics-startup-Hai-Robotics-raises-200-million-in-funding | archive-date=June 20, 2023 | url-status=live | author=Mai Tao }}</ref> [[5Y Capital]],<ref>{{cite web | title=Report: Hai Robotics Seeking $150M Investment At $1.3B Valuation | website=[[Benzinga]] | date=July 7, 2021 | url=https://www.benzinga.com/startups/21/07/21882881/report-hai-robotics-seeking-150m-investment-at-1-3b-valuation | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230617023621/https://www.benzinga.com/startups/21/07/21882881/report-hai-robotics-seeking-150m-investment-at-1-3b-valuation | archive-date=June 17, 2023 | url-status=live | publisher=FreightWaves }}</ref> and [[Source Code Capital]],<ref>{{cite web | author=Xinmei Shen | title=China robot unicorn Hai Robotics eyes international expansion as market for warehouse automation cranks up | newspaper=[[South China Morning Post]] | date=May 20, 2022 | url=https://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-trends/article/3178385/china-robot-unicorn-hai-robotics-eyes-international-expansion | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230612060241/https://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-trends/article/3178385/china-robot-unicorn-hai-robotics-eyes-international-expansion | archive-date=June 12, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> among others. The company's robots are powered by [[Intel]] [[Integrated circuit|chip]]s.<ref>{{cite web | author=Eleanor Olcott | title=The quiet ascent of Chinese high-tech start-ups | work=[[Financial Times]] | date=October 3, 2022 | url=https://www.ft.com/content/54f26781-bb54-4f2a-8277-99d7eb4c864c | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230807035915/https://www.ft.com/content/54f26781-bb54-4f2a-8277-99d7eb4c864c | archive-date=August 7, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref>

With headquarters in [[Shenzhen]], Hai Robotics established presences in Japan,<ref>{{cite web | author=Arthur Friedman | title=DHL, Hai Robotics Advance Autonomous Warehouse Tech | work=[[Sourcing Journal]] | date=November 8, 2021 | url=https://sourcingjournal.com/topics/logistics/dhl-supply-chain-invar-hai-robotics-autonomous-warehouse-equipment-311943/ | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230616085635/https://sourcingjournal.com/topics/logistics/dhl-supply-chain-invar-hai-robotics-autonomous-warehouse-equipment-311943/ | archive-date=June 16, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> Singapore, the US,<ref>{{cite web | author=Brian Heater | title=The year of living autonomously | work=[[Yahoo News]] | date=January 16, 2022 | url=https://news.yahoo.com/living-autonomously-193037641.html | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230807055918/https://news.yahoo.com/living-autonomously-193037641.html | archive-date=August 7, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> the UK,<ref>{{cite web | last=Wilson | first=Molly | title=Hai Robotics cements UK expansion with first office in Northampton town centre | work=[[Northampton Chronicle and Echo]] | date=July 7, 2023 | url=https://www.northamptonchron.co.uk/business/hai-robotics-cements-uk-expansion-with-first-office-in-northampton-4211061 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230806150605/https://www.northamptonchron.co.uk/business/hai-robotics-cements-uk-expansion-with-first-office-in-northampton-4211061 | archive-date=August 6, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> the Netherlands,<ref>{{cite web | author=Kate Park | title=Hai Robotics picks up $200M for its warehouse robot | work=[[Yahoo News]] | date=September 22, 2021 | url=https://sg.news.yahoo.com/hai-robotics-picks-200m-warehouse-081023943.html | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230807054232/https://sg.news.yahoo.com/hai-robotics-picks-200m-warehouse-081023943.html | archive-date=August 7, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> and others. In February 2022, the company was included in an analysis published by [[Frost & Sullivan]] on the robotics industry.<ref>{{cite web | author= | title=Growth Opportunities in Robotic Grippers, Autonomous Mobile Robots, and 3D Printing | work=Research and Markets | date=February 6, 2022 | url=https://www.researchandmarkets.com/reports/5601845/growth-opportunities-in-robotic-grippers | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230616091037/https://www.researchandmarkets.com/reports/5601845/growth-opportunities-in-robotic-grippers | archive-date=June 16, 2023 | url-status=live | publisher=[[Frost & Sullivan]] }}</ref> In June of the same year, it received a $100 million investment with a [[Blue chip (stock market)|blue-chip]] US dollar fund as one of the investors.<ref>{{cite web | author=Eudora Wang | title=China's HAI ROBOTICS snags over $100m in Series D+ led by Capital Today | work=[[DealStreetAsia]] | date=June 14, 2022 | url=https://www.dealstreetasia.com/stories/hai-robotics-raises-over-100m-296556 | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230615025850/https://www.dealstreetasia.com/stories/hai-robotics-raises-over-100m-296556 | archive-date=June 15, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref>

==History==
In 2016, Hai Robotics was established in Shenzhen.<ref>{{cite web | author1=Laura Westbrook | author2=Iris Deng | title=Hong Kong vs Shenzhen: a technology tale of 2 cities, and a game of catch-up | work=[[South China Morning Post]] | date=June 18, 2022 | url=https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/hong-kong-economy/article/3180069/hong-kong-vs-shenzhen-technology-tale-2-cities-and | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230616142417/https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/hong-kong-economy/article/3180069/hong-kong-vs-shenzhen-technology-tale-2-cities-and | archive-date=June 16, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> Prior to formal establishment, it launched its first ACR system, HaiPick, in 2015.<ref>{{cite news | title=Hai Robotics seeks to bring intelligent logistics solutions to Southeast Asia with its newly opened Singapore demo center | work=[[International Business Times]] | date=October 18, 2022 | url=https://www.ibtimes.sg/hai-robotics-seeks-bring-intelligent-logistics-solutions-southeast-asia-its-newly-opened-67348 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230615062435/https://www.ibtimes.sg/hai-robotics-seeks-bring-intelligent-logistics-solutions-southeast-asia-its-newly-opened-67348 | archive-date=June 15, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> In its early days, it was backed by [[HKUST]] professor Li Zexiang.<ref>{{cite web | author=Jane Zhang | title=Professor Behind $12 Billion Empire Fuels China's Tech Rise | work=[[Bloomberg News]] | date=September 18, 2022 | url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-09-18/professor-behind-12-billion-empire-fuels-china-s-tech-rise | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230620122156/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-09-18/professor-behind-12-billion-empire-fuels-china-s-tech-rise | archive-date=June 20, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref>

In 2018, the company's multi-bin robots were put into operation.<ref>{{cite web | title=Hai Robotics Received RMB 100 Million in Financing | newspaper=[[The Nikkei]] | date=October 6, 2020 | url=https://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXMZO64583970T01C20A0FFE000/ | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230616052947/https://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXMZO64583970T01C20A0FFE000/ | archive-date=June 16, 2023 | url-status=live | author= }}</ref> In September 2021, Hai Robotics secured about $200 million in a Series C funding round.<ref>{{cite web | author=Lucinda Shen | title=Venture capital firm Greylock gears up for mango seeds | magazine=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] | date=September 22, 2021 | url=https://fortune.com/2021/09/22/venture-capital-firm-greylock-gears-up-for-mango-seeds/ | archive-url=https://archive.ph/20230601141807/https://fortune.com/2021/09/22/venture-capital-firm-greylock-gears-up-for-mango-seeds/ | archive-date=January 31, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref>

In January 2022, Hai Robotics opened a demonstration center in [[Silicon Valley]].<ref>{{cite web | last=Lewis | first=Chris | title=HAI Robotics announces new demo center | work=[[Logistics Management (magazine)|Logistics Management]] | date=March 29, 2022 | url=https://www.logisticsmgmt.com/article/hai_robotics_announces_new_demo_center | ISSN=1540-3890 }}</ref> In February, the firm raised a funding round of about $170 million,<ref>{{cite web | author=Pamela Rauleder | title=Infineon to Invest €2 Billion in New Plant in Malaysia | work=[[Business Insider]] | date=February 18, 2022 | url=https://www.businessinsider.de/gruenderszene/business/infineon-baut-neue-fabrik-in-malaysia/ | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230131202856/https://www.businessinsider.de/gruenderszene/business/infineon-baut-neue-fabrik-in-malaysia/ | archive-date=January 31, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref> bringing its valuation to more than $2 billion.<ref>Reuters Staff. {{cite web | title=Sequoia Capital-backed Hai Robotics Valued at More Than $2 Billion in Fresh Funding Round | work=[[Reuters]] | date=February 18, 2022 | url=https://www.reuters.com/article/MEDIA-%E7%BA%A2%E6%9D%89%E6%94%AF%E6%8C%81%E7%9A%84%E4%B8%AD%E5%9B%BD%E6%9C%BA%E5%99%A8%E4%BA%BA%E5%8E%82%E5%95%86%E6%B5%B7%E6%9F%94%E5%88%9B%E6%96%B0%E5%B0%86%E8%9E%8D%E8%B5%84%EF%BC%8C%E4%BC%B0%E5%80%BC20%E4%BA%BF%E7%BE%8E%E5%85%83-%E6%8A%A5%E5%AF%BC-idCNL6S2UT01L | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230807074802/https://www.reuters.com/article/MEDIA-%E7%BA%A2%E6%9D%89%E6%94%AF%E6%8C%81%E7%9A%84%E4%B8%AD%E5%9B%BD%E6%9C%BA%E5%99%A8%E4%BA%BA%E5%8E%82%E5%95%86%E6%B5%B7%E6%9F%94%E5%88%9B%E6%96%B0%E5%B0%86%E8%9E%8D%E8%B5%84%EF%BC%8C%E4%BC%B0%E5%80%BC20%E4%BA%BF%E7%BE%8E%E5%85%83-%E6%8A%A5%E5%AF%BC-idCNL6S2UT01L | archive-date=August 7, 2023 | url-status=live }}</ref>

'''Hevertton Ciriaco Santos''' (born 1 February 2001) is a Brazilian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[right-back]] for [[C.F. Estrela da Amadora|Estrela da Amadora]].

==Professional career==
Santos was born in Brazil, and moved to Portugal at a young age. He began playing football with [[Club Internacional de Foot-ball|CIF]] in 2010, and the following year moved to [[Sporting CP]] where he finished his development. On 7 March 2019, he signed his first professional contract with the club.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jn.pt/desporto/hevertton-santos-assina-contrato-profissional-e-fica-com-clausula-de-45-milhoes-10656241.html/|title=Hevertton Santos assina contrato profissional e fica com cláusula de 45 milhões|website=Jornal de Notícias}}</ref> He started training with [[Sporting CP B]] in 2020, and on 3 August 2021 extended his professional contract for 3 years.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://camaroteleonino.blogs.sapo.pt/hevertton-santos-renova-com-o-sporting-6948990|title=Hevertton Santos renova com o Sporting|website=camaroteleonino.blogs.sapo.pt}}</ref> On 4 July 2022, Santos was part of Sporting's senior team preseason training.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-betclic/sporting/detalhe/hevertton-entra-nas-opcoes-de-amorim|title=Hevertton entra nas opções de Amorim|website=www.record.pt}}</ref> On 25 July 2022, Santos transferred to [[C.F. Estrela da Amadora|Estrela da Amadora]] in the [[Liga Portugal 2]] on a 2-year contract.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-betclic/sporting/detalhe/hevertton-santos-deixa-sporting-e-ruma-ao-estrela-da-amadora|title=Hevertton Santos deixa Sporting e reforça Estrela da Amadora|website=www.record.pt}}</ref> He helped Estrela da Amadora achieve promotion into the [[Primeira Liga]] for the 2023–24 season.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.abola.pt/nnh/2023-06-24/e-amadora-hevertton-da-garantias-e-deve-continuar/https%3a%2f%2fwww.abola.pt%2fnnh%2f2023-06-24%2fe-amadora-hevertton-da-garantias-e-deve-continuar%2f993449|title=Hevertton dá garantias e deve continuar (E. Amadora)|website=A Bola}}</ref>

name: Pere Guardiola
info:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pere_Guardiola

Das osmnezz:


'''Pere Guardiola i Sala''' (born 16 July 1976) is a Spanish businessman and agent who is the chairman of [[Girona FC|Girona]].

==Agent career==

In 2009, Guardiola founded football agency Media Base Sports.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.elespanol.com/deportes/futbol/20200916/renacer-girona-pere-guardiola-independentismo-relacion-beckham/521197877_0.html|title=Pere Guardiola, el independentismo y su relación con Beckham|publisher=elespanol.com}}</ref> The agency has focused on representing Portuguese and Spanish prospects.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://archive.ph/wip/i1JfR|title=Who is Pere Guardiola?|publisher=goal.com (Archived)}}</ref> He has worked as an agent for Uruguay international [[Luis Suárez]] and Spain international [[Andrés Iniesta]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/aug/29/girona-manchester-city-pep-guardiola-brother-questions|title=Why Girona? Manchester City’s deal with Pep Guardiola’s brother raises questions|publisher=theguardian.com}}</ref>
He has been regarded as one of the most powerful football agents.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://archive.ph/wip/apty3|title=Guardiola one of football's most powerful men}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2188531-jorge-mendes-and-the-25-most-powerful-agents-in-football|title=25 Most Powerful Agents in Football|publisher=bleacherreport.com}}</ref>

==Chairman of Girona==

In 2017, he acquired sixteen percent of shares of Spanish side [[Girona FC|Girona]] before becoming the club's chairman by 2020.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/girona/pere-guardiola-girona-ganar-85777281|title=Pere Guardiola: "El Girona puede ganar a cualquiera"|publisher=sport.es}}</ref> He has combined this position with a position at football agency Sports Entertainment Group.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://as.com/futbol/pere-un-guardiola-del-girona-n/|title=Pere, un Guardiola del Girona|publisher=as.com}}</ref>
Under him, Girona achieved promotion to the Spanish [[La Liga]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.elperiodico.com/es/deportes/20220623/pere-guardiola-girona-ahora-preparados-primera-13916307|title=Pere Guardiola: "Ahora estamos más preparados que la primera vez que subimos"|publisher=elperiodico.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.elmundo.es/cronica/2017/06/18/5944f56c468aebf5408b4577.html|title=Pere, 'el manager'|publisher=elmundo.es}}</ref>

=== Development ===
=== Development ===
On 18 February 2022, Srinivasaa Silver Screen announced their next film, which is directed by [[Boyapati Srinu]] and would star [[Ram Pothineni]] in the lead role. It was tentatively titled as ''BoyapatiRAPO''.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-02-18 |title=Ram Pothineni and Boyapati Sreenu come together for a pan-India film |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/ram-pothineni-and-boyapati-sreenu-come-together-for-a-pan-india-film/articleshow/89668234.cms?from=mdr |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-8257}}</ref> A [[Muhurat shot|muhurtam]] puja was held on 1 June 2022 in [[Hyderabad]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-10-03 |title=Ram Pothineni to kickstart the shoot of his next with Boyapati Sreenu |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/ram-pothineni-to-kickstart-the-shoot-of-his-next-with-boyapati-sreenu/articleshow/94622131.cms?from=mdr |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-8257}}</ref> On 5 October 2022, [[Sreeleela]] was announced to play the lead female role, alongside Pothineni for the first time.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-10-05 |title=Sreeleela to play female lead opposite Ram Pothineni in 'BoyapatiRAPO' |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/sreeleela-to-play-female-lead-opposite-ram-pothineni-in-boyapatirapo/articleshow/94664327.cms?from=mdr |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-8257}}</ref> On 3 July 2023, a glimpse was released, which revealed the title ''Skanda.''<ref>{{Cite news |last=Bureau |first=The Hindu |date=2023-07-03 |title=Boyapati Sreenu, Ram Pothineni’s Telugu action entertainer titled ‘Skanda - the attacker’ |language=en-IN |work=The Hindu |url=https://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/ram-pothineni-boyapati-sreenu-in-action-mode-with-skanda/article67036501.ece |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-751X}}</ref>
On 18 February 2022, Srinivasaa Silver Screen announced their next film, which is directed by [[Boyapati Srinu]] and would star [[Ram Pothineni]] in the lead role. It was tentatively titled as ''BoyapatiRAPO''.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-02-18 |title=Ram Pothineni and Boyapati Sreenu come together for a pan-India film |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/ram-pothineni-and-boyapati-sreenu-come-together-for-a-pan-india-film/articleshow/89668234.cms?from=mdr |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-8257}}</ref> A [[Muhurat shot|muhurtam]] puja was held on 1 June 2022 in [[Hyderabad]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-10-03 |title=Ram Pothineni to kickstart the shoot of his next with Boyapati Sreenu |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/ram-pothineni-to-kickstart-the-shoot-of-his-next-with-boyapati-sreenu/articleshow/94622131.cms?from=mdr |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-8257}}</ref> On 5 October 2022, [[Sreeleela]] was announced to play the lead female role, alongside [[Ram Pothineni]] for the first time.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2022-10-05 |title=Sreeleela to play female lead opposite Ram Pothineni in 'BoyapatiRAPO' |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/telugu/movies/news/sreeleela-to-play-female-lead-opposite-ram-pothineni-in-boyapatirapo/articleshow/94664327.cms?from=mdr |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-8257}}</ref> On 3 July 2023, a glimpse was released, which revealed the title ''Skanda.''<ref>{{Cite news |last=Bureau |first=The Hindu |date=2023-07-03 |title=Boyapati Sreenu, Ram Pothineni’s Telugu action entertainer titled ‘Skanda - the attacker’ |language=en-IN |work=The Hindu |url=https://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/ram-pothineni-boyapati-sreenu-in-action-mode-with-skanda/article67036501.ece |access-date=2023-08-26 |issn=0971-751X}}</ref>

name: Spitalfields
info:

Administrative history: clarify relationship to Whitechapel DBW

← Previous revision Revision as of 10:56, 31 August 2023
Line 39: Line 39:
In 1729, the Hamlet of Spitalfields became an independent parish. The area's parish church was [[Christ Church, Spitalfields]], with St Stephen Spitalfields (demolished in 1930) added later.
In 1729, the Hamlet of Spitalfields became an independent parish. The area's parish church was [[Christ Church, Spitalfields]], with St Stephen Spitalfields (demolished in 1930) added later.


In 1855, the parish became part of the [[Whitechapel District (Metropolis)|Whitechapel District]] of the [[Metropolitan Board of Works]] for certain infrastructure purposes. Spitalfields retained its civil parish functions.
In 1855, the parish became part of the [[Whitechapel District (Metropolis)|Whitechapel District]] within the [[Metropolitan Board of Works]] area. Spitalfields Vestry nominated twelve members to the Whitechapel District Board of Works.


Spitalfields became part of the [[Metropolitan Borough of Stepney]] in 1900 and was abolished as a civil parish in 1921. It became part of the [[London Borough of Tower Hamlets]] in 1965.<ref>{{cite book |last=Youngs |first= Frederic A, Jr. |title=Guide to the Local Administrative Units of England, Vol.I: Southern England |year=1979 |publisher=[[Royal Historical Society]] |location=London |isbn=0-901050-67-9 }}</ref>
Spitalfields became part of the [[Metropolitan Borough of Stepney]] in 1900 and was abolished as a civil parish in 1921. It became part of the [[London Borough of Tower Hamlets]] in 1965.<ref>{{cite book |last=Youngs |first= Frederic A, Jr. |title=Guide to the Local Administrative Units of England, Vol.I: Southern England |year=1979 |publisher=[[Royal Historical Society]] |location=London |isbn=0-901050-67-9 }}</ref>

name: BLT
info:

← Previous revision Revision as of 10:56, 31 August 2023
Line 38: Line 38:
===Variations===
===Variations===
[[File:Bacon, lettuce, tomato, and avocado.jpg|thumb|BLT with avocado]]
[[File:Bacon, lettuce, tomato, and avocado.jpg|thumb|BLT with avocado]]
The sandwich has a high sodium and fat content, and has been specifically targeted by UK café chains in an effort to reduce salt and fat.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cafe chains promise to reduce salt and fat|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/health/cafe-chains-promise-to-reduce-salt-and-fat-14217109.html|access-date=11 February 2011|newspaper=Belfast Telegraph|date=7 March 2009}}</ref> Due to this, low-fat mayonnaise is a common substitute along with low salt bread and less fatty bacon. A more visible solution is to use [[turkey bacon]] in lieu of normal bacon.<ref name="prevent">{{cite book|last=Bricklin |first=Mark |title=Prevention Magazine's Nutrition Advisor: The Ultimate Guide to the Health-Boosting and Health-Harming Factors in Your Diet |year=1994 |publisher=Rodale |isbn=0-87596-225-4 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iPFokL0MuswC&q=BLT+bacon&pg=PA454 |page=454}}</ref> One of the variations on the BLT is the [[club sandwich]], a two-layered sandwich in which one layer is a BLT. The other layer can be almost any sort of sliced meat, normally chicken or turkey.<ref>{{cite book|last=Civitello|first=Linda|title=Cuisine and culture: a history of food and people|year=2007|publisher=John Wiley and Sons|isbn=978-0-471-74172-5|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MBRBjBTEBHYC&q=BLT+club+differences&pg=PA180|page=180}}</ref>
The sandwich has a high sodium and fat content, and has been specifically targeted by UK café chains in an effort to reduce salt and fat.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cafe chains promise to reduce salt and fat|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/health/cafe-chains-promise-to-reduce-salt-and-fat-14217109.html|access-date=11 February 2011|newspaper=Belfast Telegraph|date=7 March 2009}}</ref> Due to this, low-fat mayonnaise is a common substitute along with low salt bread and less fatty bacon. A more visible solution is to use [[turkey bacon]] in lieu of normal bacon.<ref name="prevent">{{cite book|last=Bricklin |first=Mark |title=Prevention Magazine's Nutrition Advisor: The Ultimate Guide to the Health-Boosting and Health-Harming Factors in Your Diet |year=1994 |publisher=Rodale |isbn=0-87596-225-4 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iPFokL0MuswC&q=BLT+bacon&pg=PA454 |page=454}}</ref> One of the variations on the BLT is the [https://culinaryisart.com/club-sandwich-recipe/ club sandwich], a two-layered sandwich in which one layer is a BLT. The other layer can be almost any sort of sliced meat, normally chicken or turkey.<ref>{{cite book|last=Civitello|first=Linda|title=Cuisine and culture: a history of food and people|year=2007|publisher=John Wiley and Sons|isbn=978-0-471-74172-5|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MBRBjBTEBHYC&q=BLT+club+differences&pg=PA180|page=180}}</ref>

Antigens are recognized by antigen receptors, including antibodies and T-cell receptors.<ref name=clev/> Diverse antigen receptors are made by cells of the immune system so that each cell has a specificity for a single antigen.<ref name=clev/> Upon exposure to an antigen, only the lymphocytes that recognize that antigen are activated and expanded, a process known as [[clonal selection]].<ref name=Abbas/> In most cases, antibodies are ''antigen-specific'', meaning that an antibody can only react to and bind one specific antigen; in some instances, however, antibodies may [[cross-reactivity|cross-react]] to bind more than one antigen. The reaction between an antigen and an antibody is called the [[antigen-antibody reaction]].
Antigens are recognized by antigen receptors, including antibodies and T-cell receptors.<ref name=clev/> Diverse antigen receptors are made by cells of the immune system so that each cell has a specificity for a single antigen.<ref name=clev/> Upon exposure to an antigen, only the lymphocytes that recognize that antigen are activated and expanded, a process known as [[clonal selection]].<ref name=Abbas/> In most cases, antibodies are ''antigen-specific'', meaning that an antibody can only react to and bind one specific antigen; in some instances, however, antibodies may [[cross-reactivity|cross-react]] to bind more than one antigen. The reaction between an antigen and an antibody is called the [[antigen-antibody reaction]].


Antigen can also originate from within the body ("[[self-protein]]" or "self antigens") or from the external environment ("non-self").<ref name=mlp/> The immune system identifies and attacks "non-self" external antigens. Antibodies usually do not react with self-antigens due to [[central tolerance|negative selection]] of [[T cell]]s in the [[thymus]] and [[B cell]]s in the [[bone marrow]].<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Gallucci S, Lolkema M, Matzinger P | title = Natural adjuvants: endogenous activators of dendritic cells | journal = Nature Medicine | volume = 5 | issue = 11 | pages = 1249–1255 | date = November 1999 | pmid = 10545990 | doi = 10.1038/15200 | s2cid = 29090284 }}</ref> The diseases in which antibodies react with self antigens and damage the body's own cells are called [[autoimmune disease]]s.<ref>{{cite book | vauthors = Janeway Jr CA, Travers P, Walport M, Shlomchik MJ |date=2001 |chapter=Autoimmune responses are directed against self antigens |chapter-url=https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK27155/ |title=Immunobiology: The Immune System in Health and Disease. |publisher=Elsevier España | edition = 5th |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=KoHxpimwSWUC |oclc=45708106 |isbn=9780815336426}}</ref>

Antibodies usually do not react with self-antigens due to [[central tolerance|negative selection]] of [[T cell]]s in the [[thymus]] and [[B cell]]s in the [[bone marrow]].<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Gallucci S, Lolkema M, Matzinger P | title = Natural adjuvants: endogenous activators of dendritic cells | journal = Nature Medicine | volume = 5 | issue = 11 | pages = 1249–1255 | date = November 1999 | pmid = 10545990 | doi = 10.1038/15200 | s2cid = 29090284 }}</ref> The diseases in which antibodies react with self antigens and damage the body's own cells are called [[autoimmune disease]]s.<ref>{{cite book | vauthors = Janeway Jr CA, Travers P, Walport M, Shlomchik MJ |date=2001 |chapter=Autoimmune responses are directed against self antigens |chapter-url=https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK27155/ |title=Immunobiology: The Immune System in Health and Disease. |publisher=Elsevier España | edition = 5th |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=KoHxpimwSWUC |oclc=45708106 |isbn=9780815336426}}</ref>


[[Vaccine]]s are examples of antigens in an immunogenic form, which are intentionally administered to a recipient to induce the memory function of the [[adaptive immune system]] towards antigens of the pathogen invading that recipient. The vaccine for [[seasonal influenza]] is a common example.<ref name="cdc">{{cite web |title=Antigenic characterization |url=https://www.cdc.gov/flu/about/professionals/antigenic.htm |publisher=US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention |access-date=13 October 2020 |date=15 October 2019}}</ref>

←Created page with 'Clothing in India changes depending on the different ethnicity, geography, climate, and cultural traditions of the people of each region of India. Ethnic clothing is just one of the things that distinguish one part of India from the other. The craftsmanship with whi...'

New page

Clothing in India changes depending on the different ethnicity, geography, climate, and cultural traditions of the people of each region of India. The clothing in India also encompasses the wide variety of Indian embroidery, prints, handwork, embellishment, styles of wearing cloths.

India is known for its diversity the all over the globe. Ethnic clothing is just one of the things that distinguish one part of India from the other. The craftsmanship with which artisans create traditional dresses is really incredible. All forms of clothing are quite labor intensive and require a lot of attention to detail. Many of these art forms are dying because the cost of production is higher and few people can afford to pay the high cost of the dress. As every state in India is geographically different from the other, this has given rise to varied kinds of dresses and styles. The Saree is one Indian dress that enjoys worldwide popularity. Artisans across the country make use of locally available resources to produce sarees, which are a masterpiece in their own self. The beautiful weaves and designs on sarees makes one wonder about the creativity of these weavers. Different regions of India have different specialty and variety of sarees.

Founded in 1986 and Mangoozn.in born in 2012 as a lifestyle fashion brand that makes creative, distinctive fashion for the trendy, contemporary Indian. Mangoozn.in online platform was created to have an impact on Men, Women and Kid dressing through innovation, honesty and thoughtfulness.

All our products are handpicked and sourced from multiple designers and manufacturers across India. We like to experiment freely, which allows us to balance creativity and reliability, and our innovative designs. Our innovation focus extends to our operations as well. We are vertically integrated, and have our own designers who manufacture our own products, and we cut out the middleman wherever possible. This direct-to-consumer model allows us to create high-quality fashion at affordable prices.

==History==
The [[Roman villa of Chiragan]] was built on the bank of the [[Garonne]], in the reign of [[Augustus]], on the road from [[Toulouse]] to [[Lugdunum Convenarum]] and onward to [[Dax]]. As the villa grew in size and importance in the second and third centuries, the settlement of Calagurris developed.

==History==
==History==
Although the structure was conceived in 1846 during the reign of King [[Nangklao|(Rama III)]] it was not completed during his reign. Several attempts were made by King Rama III's successor to complete it but it was never successful. It was only in 1960 under [[Bhumibol Adulyadej|Rama IX]] construction was restarted. It was survised by the [[Fine Arts Department|Fine Arts Department of Thailand]].
Although the structure was conceived in 1846 during the reign of King [[Nangklao|(Rama III)]] it was not completed during his reign. Several attempts were made by King Rama III's successor to complete it but it was never successful. It was only in 1960 under [[Bhumibol Adulyadej|Rama IX]] construction was restarted. It was supervised by the [[Fine Arts Department|Fine Arts Department of Thailand]]. In 1995 a [[Relics associated with Buddha|Buddha relic]] was enshrined at the topmost spire of the Loha Parsat. In 2007 it was opened to public.

Line 184: Line 184:
After the [[1880 Zagreb earthquake]], up to the 1914 outbreak of [[World War I]], development flourished and the town received the characteristic layout which it has today.
After the [[1880 Zagreb earthquake]], up to the 1914 outbreak of [[World War I]], development flourished and the town received the characteristic layout which it has today.
The first horse-drawn [[tram]] was used in 1891. The construction of the railway lines enabled the old suburbs to merge gradually into [[Donji grad (Zagreb)|Donji Grad]], characterized by a regular block pattern that prevails in [[Central Europe]]an cities. This bustling core hosts many imposing buildings, monuments, and parks as well as a multitude of museums, theatres, and cinemas. An [[power station|electric power plant]] was built in 1907.

[[File:Bakrorez panorame Zagreba iz 1822.jpg|left|thumb|upright=1.4|Copperplate of the panorama of Zagreb from [[1822]]]]
[[File:Bakrorez panorame Zagreba iz 1822.jpg|left|thumb|upright=1.6|Copperplate of the panorama of Zagreb from [[1822]]]]


Since 1 January 1877, the [[Grič cannon]] is fired daily from the [[Lotrščak Tower]] on [[Grič, Zagreb|Grič]] to mark midday. The first half of the 20th century saw a considerable expansion of Zagreb. Before World War I, the city expanded and neighborhoods like [[Stara Peščenica]] in the east and [[Črnomerec]] in the west were created. After the war, [[working class|working-class]] districts such as [[Trnje, Zagreb|Trnje]] emerged between the railway and the [[Sava]], whereas the construction of residential districts on the hills of the southern slopes of [[Medvednica]] was completed [[Interwar period|between the two World Wars]].

'''Google Duo''' is a discontinued [[Proprietary software|proprietary]] [[voice over IP]] (VoIP) and [[videotelephony]] service developed by [[Google]], available for [[Android (operating system)|Android]], [[IOS]] and [[web browser]]s. It let users make and receive one-to-one and group audio and video calls with other Duo users in [[High-definition video|high definition]], using [[end-to-end encryption]] by default. Duo could be used either with a phone number or a [[Google Account|Google account]], allowing users to call someone from their contact list.<ref name="Features">{{cite web |last1=Fulay |first1=Amit |last2=Adan |first2=Yariv |date=May 18, 2016 |title=Saying hello to Allo and Duo: new apps for smart messaging and video calling |url=https://blog.google/products/allo/allo-duo-apps-messaging-video/|website=Google: The Keyword Blog}}</ref>
'''Google Duo''' is a deprecated [[Proprietary software|proprietary]] [[voice over IP]] (VoIP) and [[videotelephony]] service developed by [[Google]], available for [[Android (operating system)|Android]], [[IOS]] and [[web browser]]s. It let users make and receive one-to-one and group audio and video calls with other Duo users in [[High-definition video|high definition]], using [[end-to-end encryption]] by default. Duo could be used either with a phone number or a [[Google Account|Google account]], allowing users to call someone from their contact list.<ref name="Features">{{cite web |last1=Fulay |first1=Amit |last2=Adan |first2=Yariv |date=May 18, 2016 |title=Saying hello to Allo and Duo: new apps for smart messaging and video calling |url=https://blog.google/products/allo/allo-duo-apps-messaging-video/|website=Google: The Keyword Blog}}</ref>


Google Duo was announced at [[Google I/O|Google's developer conference]] on May 18, 2016, and began its worldwide release on August 16, 2016.<ref>{{Cite news |title=The 10 biggest announcements from Google I/O 2016 |last1=Brandom |first1=Russell |last2=Dzieza |first2=Josh |last3=O'Kane |first3=Sean |website=The Verge |date=18 May 2016 |url= https://www.theverge.com/2016/5/18/11701030/google-io-2016-keynote-highlights-announcements-recap}}</ref> Google announced in 2022 that the service would be merged into [[Google Meet]], and it was shut down by the end of the year.

'''''Adhu Oru Kana Kaalam''''' ({{translation|That was a period of dream}}) is a 2005 Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil]]-language [[romantic drama film]] written and directed by [[Balu Mahendra]]. The film featured [[Dhanush]] and [[Priyamani]] , while [[Karunas]] and [[Delhi Ganesh]] played supporting roles. The music for the film was scored by [[Ilaiyaraaja]], while Sai Suresh produced the venture. The film is a remake of the director's own Malayalam film ''[[Yatra]]''. It was remade in to Telugu as ''[[Nireekshana]]''. The film was released on 2 November 2005, coinciding with [[Diwali]], and received a below average response commercially.
'''''Adhu Oru Kana Kaalam''''' ({{translation|That was a period of dream}}) is a 2005 Indian [[Tamil language|Tamil]]-language [[romantic drama film]] written and directed by [[Balu Mahendra]]. The film featured [[Dhanush]] and [[Priyamani]] , while [[Karunas]] and [[Delhi Ganesh]] played supporting roles. The music for the film was scored by [[Ilaiyaraaja]], while Sai Suresh produced the venture. The film is a remake of the director's own Malayalam film ''[[Yathra|Yatra]]''. It was remade in to Telugu as ''[[Nireekshana]]''. The film was released on 2 November 2005, coinciding with [[Diwali]], and received a below average response commercially.

== Life ==
Pot Roast was adopted as a kitten in 2014, when her owner met her at an event hosted by the [[Missouri University of Science and Technology]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |date=2021-05-24 |title=Pot Roast is KC's viral TikTok feline celeb |url=https://www.thepitchkc.com/pot-roast-is-kcs-tiktok-viral-feline-celeb/ |access-date=2023-05-01 |website=The Pitch |language=en-US}}</ref> She was originally going to be named Concrete; however, Pot Roast’s mom couldn’t spell Concrete consistently. The name Pot Roast was inspired by the "Caucasian middle class dish" of [[Pot roast|the same name]].<ref name=":6" /> Her owner, a student at the time, kept the kitten in her [[Fraternities and sororities|sorority]] house for a week, but due to the house's no-pet rule, the kitten took up residence in the neighboring fraternity house.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |last=Dodgson |first=Lindsay |title=Fans are heartbroken on learning the beloved TikTok famous cat Pot Roast has died |url=https://www.insider.com/beloved-tiktok-famous-cat-pot-roast-has-died-fans-heartbroken-2022-2 |access-date=2023-05-01 |website=Insider |language=en-US}}</ref> The shelter was not forthcoming about all of the cat's health problems, including [[Feline viral rhinotracheitis|feline herpes]] and [[stomatitis]] (which resulted in all of her teeth eventually being extracted).<ref name=":1" /> Pot Roast’s mom kept her teeth and pasted them on a canvas.<ref name=":0" />

The name Pot Roast was inspired by the "Caucasian middle class dish" of [[Pot roast|the same name]].<ref name=":6" /> Her owner, a student at the time, kept the kitten in her [[Fraternities and sororities|sorority]] house for a week, but due to the house's no-pet rule, the kitten took up residence in the neighboring fraternity house.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |last=Dodgson |first=Lindsay |title=Fans are heartbroken on learning the beloved TikTok famous cat Pot Roast has died |url=https://www.insider.com/beloved-tiktok-famous-cat-pot-roast-has-died-fans-heartbroken-2022-2 |access-date=2023-05-01 |website=Insider |language=en-US}}</ref> The shelter was not forthcoming about all of the cat's health problems, including [[Feline viral rhinotracheitis|feline herpes]] and [[stomatitis]] (which resulted in all of her teeth eventually being extracted).<ref name=":1" /> Pot Roast’s mom kept her teeth and pasted them on a canvas.<ref name=":0" />


After first posting on TikTok in late 2020, Pot Roast and her owner quickly gained traction, in part due to the cat's "listless" and "stiff-limbed" appearance, which resulted in an ongoing joke that Pot Roast was [[Taxidermy|taxidermied]].<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":3">{{Cite web |last=Wanshel |first=Elyse |date=2022-02-17 |title=Cat Beloved On TikTok For Her 'Taxidermy' Energy Has Died |url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/pot-roast-cat-tiktok-axidermy-died_n_620e6a4fe4b097efdfbd7e78 |access-date=2023-05-01 |website=HuffPost |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Schroeder |first=Audra |date=2022-02-17 |title=Beloved TikTok cat Pot Roast has died |url=https://www.dailydot.com/unclick/pot-roast-cat-tiktok-dead/ |access-date=2023-05-01 |website=The Daily Dot |language=en-US}}</ref> Videos included her owner monologuing or answers to comments, all while holding Pot Roast, who sometimes wore hats.<ref name=":2" />

name: Aleppo Artillery School massacre
info:

← Previous revision Revision as of 10:56, 31 August 2023
Line 26: Line 26:


==Massacre==
==Massacre==
The massacre occurred on 16 June 1979, in the [[Ramouseh]] district of the city of [[Aleppo]], Syria, at the Aleppo Artillery School. An officer on duty, Ibrahim el-Youssef, and members of the [[Muslim Brotherhood of Syria|Syrian Muslim Brotherhood]] calling themselves the [[Fighting Vanguard]] (''at-Tali’a al-Muqatila'') and led by [[`Adnan `Uqla|ʿAdnan ʿUqla]], massacred between 83 [[Alawites|Alawi]] cadets in the Aleppo Artillery School.<ref>[http://countrystudies.us/syria/18.htm The Assad Era] Thomas Collelo, ed. Syria: A Country Study. Washington: GPO for the Library of Congress, 1987.</ref><ref>[http://ehistory.osu.edu/osu/origins/print.cfm?articleid=70 Syria's Islamist Movement and the 2011-12 Uprising] ORIGINS volume 5 issue 10 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120622031757/http://ehistory.osu.edu/osu/origins/print.cfm?articleid=70 |date=June 22, 2012 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.jewishpolicycenter.org/830/from-hama-to-hamas-syrias-islamist-policies From Hama to Hamas: Syria's Islamist Policies] inFocus SPRING 2009 • VOLUME III: NUMBER 1, [[Jewish Policy Center]]</ref> The duty officer in charge of the school called Alawite cadets to an urgent morning meeting in the mess hall of the school; when they arrived, he and his accomplices [[mass shootings|opened fire]] on the unarmed cadets with [[automatic weapon]]s and [[grenade]]s.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.shrc.org/en/?p=19785|title = The Massacre of the Military Artillery School at Aleppo – Special Report}}</ref> The incident marked the beginning of full scale urban warfare of the Syrian Muslim Brotherhood against the ruling Alawites.<ref name="books.google.co.il">{{cite book |url={{Google books |plainurl=yes |id=-2jCN5Ur6yUC |page=8 }} |title=The Hama Massacre: Reasons, Supporters of the Rebellion, Consequences |first=Kathrin Nina |last=Wiedl |publisher=GRIN Verlag |year=2006 |isbn=3-638-71034-3 |page=8 |access-date=2013-03-17 }}{{Self-published source|date=January 2015}}<!-- GRIN Verlag is book-on-demand publisher for self-publishing --></ref>
The massacre occurred on 16 June 1979, in the [[Ramouseh]] district of the city of [[Aleppo]], Syria, at the Aleppo Artillery School. An officer on duty, Ibrahim el-Youssef, and members of the [[Muslim Brotherhood of Syria|Syrian Muslim Brotherhood]] calling themselves the [[Fighting Vanguard]] (''at-Tali’a al-Muqatila'') and led by [[`Adnan `Uqla|ʿAdnan ʿUqla]], massacred 83 [[Alawites|Alawi]] cadets in the Aleppo Artillery School.<ref>[http://countrystudies.us/syria/18.htm The Assad Era] Thomas Collelo, ed. Syria: A Country Study. Washington: GPO for the Library of Congress, 1987.</ref><ref>[http://ehistory.osu.edu/osu/origins/print.cfm?articleid=70 Syria's Islamist Movement and the 2011-12 Uprising] ORIGINS volume 5 issue 10 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120622031757/http://ehistory.osu.edu/osu/origins/print.cfm?articleid=70 |date=June 22, 2012 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.jewishpolicycenter.org/830/from-hama-to-hamas-syrias-islamist-policies From Hama to Hamas: Syria's Islamist Policies] inFocus SPRING 2009 • VOLUME III: NUMBER 1, [[Jewish Policy Center]]</ref> The duty officer in charge of the school called Alawite cadets to an urgent morning meeting in the mess hall of the school; when they arrived, he and his accomplices [[mass shootings|opened fire]] on the unarmed cadets with [[automatic weapon]]s and [[grenade]]s.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.shrc.org/en/?p=19785|title = The Massacre of the Military Artillery School at Aleppo – Special Report}}</ref> The incident marked the beginning of full scale urban warfare of the Syrian Muslim Brotherhood against the ruling Alawites.<ref name="books.google.co.il">{{cite book |url={{Google books |plainurl=yes |id=-2jCN5Ur6yUC |page=8 }} |title=The Hama Massacre: Reasons, Supporters of the Rebellion, Consequences |first=Kathrin Nina |last=Wiedl |publisher=GRIN Verlag |year=2006 |isbn=3-638-71034-3 |page=8 |access-date=2013-03-17 }}{{Self-published source|date=January 2015}}<!-- GRIN Verlag is book-on-demand publisher for self-publishing --></ref>

=== Ownership transfer ===
=== Ownership transfer ===
On November 16, 2022, NARA transferred operations of the museum to the George W. Bush Foundation effective January 1, 2023. The transfer was originally agreed to in April 2022 but was paused due to concerns about "whitewashing" exhibits about controversial topics, an issue which has plagued non-NARA museums like the [[Richard Nixon Presidential Library and Museum]].<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-07-01 |title=House committee wants pause on moving parts of Bush presidential museum to foundation |url=https://www.dallasnews.com/news/politics/2022/07/01/house-committee-wants-pause-on-handing-bush-library-over-to-family-foundation/ |access-date=2023-06-20 |website=Dallas News |language=en}}</ref> To alleviate this, the foundation is required to obtain NARA and historian input, clearly designate foundation and NARA spaces, and NARA will retain all ownership of presidential artifacts which are considered loaned to the foundation for display.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2022-11-16 |title=National Archives to Transfer George W. Bush Museum Operations to the George W. Bush Foundation |url=https://www.archives.gov/press/press-releases/2023/nr23-09 |access-date=2023-06-20 |website=National Archives |language=en}}</ref>

Koch, "Ériu, Alba and Letha: When was a Language Ancestral to Gaelic First Spoken in Ireland?", ''Emania'' 9, 1991, pp. 17–27</ref>

==OgCoinn’s Theory==

A new theory has been developed after new insights gained in 2019 archeological discovery of over 100 Steele found in the southwest Iberian peninsula.

The script found in the Steele is called Conii Script, Tartessian, or Southwestern script.

Research done by John T Koch and the “University of Wales Centre for Welsh and Celtic Studies” has lead to the discovery that this southwestern script is the forerunner to the Ivernic or Iarnnbērlæ language of pre Celtic Ireland.

This discovery is supported by the affinity of Q-Celtic languages and Western Semitic language structure.
While P-Celtic languages do not show this affinity.

name: Trespass to land
info:
https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Trespass_to_land&diff=1173116866&oldid=1172286353

← Previous revision Revision as of 10:56, 31 August 2023
Line 12: Line 12:
By law, trespass for [[mesne profits]] is a suit against someone who has been ejected from property that did not belong to them. The suit is for recovery of damages the trespasser caused to the property and for any profits he or she may have made while in possession of that property.
By law, trespass for [[mesne profits]] is a suit against someone who has been ejected from property that did not belong to them. The suit is for recovery of damages the trespasser caused to the property and for any profits he or she may have made while in possession of that property.


For a trespass to be actionable, the [[tortfeasor]] must voluntarily go to a specific location but need not be aware that he entered the property of a particular person. If A forces B unwillingly onto C's land, C will not have action in trespass against B because B's actions were involuntary, but C may instead claim against A. Furthermore, if B is deceived by A as to the ownership or boundaries of C's land, A may be jointly liable with B for B's trespass.
For a trespass to be actionable, the [[tortfeasor]] must voluntarily go to a specific location but need not be aware that he entered the property of a particular person. If A forces B unwillingly onto C's land, C will not have action in trespass against B because B's actions were involuntary, but C may instead claim against A. Furthermore, even if B voluntarily entered C's land, if B was deceived by A as to the ownership or boundaries of C's land, A may be jointly liable with B for B's trespass.


In most jurisdictions, if a person were to accidentally enter onto private property, there would be no trespass, because the person did not intend any violation. However, in Australia, [[negligence]] may substitute the requirement for intent.{{citation needed|date=February 2012}}
In most jurisdictions, if a person were to accidentally enter onto private property, there would be no trespass, because the person did not intend any violation. However, in Australia, [[negligence]] may substitute the requirement for intent.{{citation needed|date=February 2012}}

The course will give you with the knowledge and skills you need to enhance your career as a Web Developer, land a better job/promotion, and raise your income through online employment and freelancing.<ref>[https://cust.edu.pk/wordpress-an-upcoming-workshop/ ]{{dead link|date=September 2022}}</ref>

'''Kurtis Matthew Kenneth Conner''' (born May 4, 1994) is a Canadian comedian, [[YouTuber]], and podcaster. {{As of|2023|April}}, his channel has over four million subscribers.
'''Kurtis Matthew Kenneth Conner''' (born May 4, 1994) is a Canadian comedian, [[YouTuber]], and podcaster. {{As of|2023|April}}, his channel has over four million subscribers.

His friends are Jacob Sharpe, Danny Gonzalez and Drew Gooden. He is married to his wife, Jenna. They have a dog kiwi together, but currently no children.
His favourite colour is green. His favourite food is pasta. His favourite movie is [[The Mummy]]. His favourite actor is not [[Tom Cruise]].

Line 21: Line 21:
Carlin began his journalism career at the ''[[Buenos Aires Herald]]'' in 1981, writing about film, football and politics. In 1982, he began a six-year stint in [[Mexico]] and Central America working for, among others, ''[[The Times]]'' and ''[[Sunday Times]],'' the ''[[Toronto Star]],'' [[BBC]], [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|CBC]], and [[ABC (US)]] before joining the staff of ''[[The Independent (London)|The Independent]]'' at the newspaper's launch in 1986.
Carlin began his journalism career at the ''[[Buenos Aires Herald]]'' in 1981, writing about film, football and politics. In 1982, he began a six-year stint in [[Mexico]] and Central America working for, among others, ''[[The Times]]'' and ''[[Sunday Times]],'' the ''[[Toronto Star]],'' [[BBC]], [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation|CBC]], and [[ABC (US)]] before joining the staff of ''[[The Independent (London)|The Independent]]'' at the newspaper's launch in 1986.


Carlin was ''[[The Independent]]'s'' South Africa bureau chief from 1989–1995.<ref name="official site cv"/> In 1993, Carlin wrote and presented a BBC documentary on the South African [[Third Force (South Africa)|Third Force]], his first television work.<ref name="official site tv">[http://www.johncarlin.eu/jc_tv.html Official site of John Carlin]{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, TV</ref>
Carlin was ''[[The Independent]]'s'' South Africa bureau chief from 1989 to 1995.<ref name="official site cv"/> In 1993, Carlin wrote and presented a BBC documentary on the South African [[Third Force (South Africa)|Third Force]], his first television work.<ref name="official site tv">[http://www.johncarlin.eu/jc_tv.html Official site of John Carlin]{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, TV</ref>


From 1995–1998 he was the United States bureau chief for ''[[The Independent on Sunday]]''.<ref name="official site cv"/>
From 1995 to 1998 he was the United States bureau chief for ''[[The Independent on Sunday]]''.<ref name="official site cv"/>


In 1997, Carlin wrote an article titled "A Farewell to Arms" for ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] ''magazine about cyberwarfare. This was originally intended to form the basis of a 1999 film, ''WW3.com''.<ref name="Variety27Jan1998">[https://www.variety.com/article/VR1117467113.html?categoryid=13&cs=1 Fox eyes 'WW3.com' as tentpole for 1999] [[Variety.com]], 27 January 1998</ref> When this project stalled, its script was rewritten into the 2007 film, ''[[Live Free or Die Hard]]'' (Die Hard 4.0).<ref name="Variety26Jul2004">[https://www.variety.com/article/VR1117908291.html?categoryId=13&cs=1 The 'Die Hard' is cast for scribe Richardson] Variety.com, 26 July 2004</ref>

===Second World War===
===Second World War===


During the Second World War, Bamber Bridge was home to the 1511 Quartermaster Truck regiment. The unit was [[Racial segregation in the United States Armed Forces|racially segregated]], and all of the soldiers except the officers were [[African American]]. Tensions in the wake of the [[1943 Detroit race riot]] caused a major fight, known as the [[Battle of Bamber Bridge]] to break out between white American military police on one side, and black American soldiers and townsfolk on the other. A Black American soldier, Private William Crossland, was killed. In June 2022, a memorial garden commemorating the battle was created opposite the pub where the Battle of Bamber Bridge started. The incident inspired the plot of the film ''[[The Railway Children Return]]''.<ref>{{cite web |date=2022-07-09 |title=Railway Children reboot: film explores black GI segregation in 40s Britain |url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2022/jul/09/the-railway-children-return-film-explores-black-gi-segregation-in-40s-britain |access-date=2022-07-11 |website=The Guardian }}</ref>
During the Second World War, Bamber Bridge was home to the 1511 Quartermaster Truck regiment. The unit was [[Racial segregation in the United States Armed Forces|racially segregated]], and all of the soldiers except the officers were [[African American]]. Tensions in the wake of the [[1943 Detroit race riot]] caused a major fight, known as the [[Battle of Bamber Bridge]] to break out between white American military police on one side, and black American soldiers and townsfolk on the other. A Black American soldier, Private William Crossland, was killed. In June 2022, a memorial garden commemorating the battle was created opposite the pub where the Battle of Bamber Bridge started. The incident inspired the plot of the 2022 film ''[[The Railway Children Return]]''.<ref>{{cite web |date=2022-07-09 |title=Railway Children reboot: film explores black GI segregation in 40s Britain |url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2022/jul/09/the-railway-children-return-film-explores-black-gi-segregation-in-40s-britain |access-date=2022-07-11 |website=The Guardian }}</ref>

info:

Administrative history: clarify relationship to Whitechapel DBW

← Previous revision Revision as of 10:56, 31 August 2023
Line 39: Line 39:
In 1729, the Hamlet of Spitalfields became an independent parish. The area's parish church was [[Christ Church, Spitalfields]], with St Stephen Spitalfields (demolished in 1930) added later.
In 1729, the Hamlet of Spitalfields became an independent parish. The area's parish church was [[Christ Church, Spitalfields]], with St Stephen Spitalfields (demolished in 1930) added later.


In 1855, the parish became part of the [[Whitechapel District (Metropolis)|Whitechapel District]] of the [[Metropolitan Board of Works]] for certain infrastructure purposes. Spitalfields retained its civil parish functions.
In 1855, the parish became part of the [[Whitechapel District (Metropolis)|Whitechapel District]] within the [[Metropolitan Board of Works]] area. Spitalfields Vestry nominated twelve members to the Whitechapel District Board of Works.


Spitalfields became part of the [[Metropolitan Borough of Stepney]] in 1900 and was abolished as a civil parish in 1921. It became part of the [[London Borough of Tower Hamlets]] in 1965.<ref>{{cite book |last=Youngs |first= Frederic A, Jr. |title=Guide to the Local Administrative Units of England, Vol.I: Southern England |year=1979 |publisher=[[Royal Historical Society]] |location=London |isbn=0-901050-67-9 }}</ref>
Spitalfields became part of the [[Metropolitan Borough of Stepney]] in 1900 and was abolished as a civil parish in 1921. name: BLT
info:

← Previous revision Revision as of 10:56, 31 August 2023
Line 38: Line 38:
===Variations===
===Variations===
[[File:Bacon, lettuce, tomato, and avocado.jpg|thumb|BLT with avocado]]
[[File:Bacon, lettuce, tomato, and avocado.jpg|thumb|BLT with avocado]]
The sandwich has a high sodium and fat content, and has been specifically targeted by UK café chains in an effort to reduce salt and fat.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cafe chains promise to reduce salt and fat|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/health/cafe-chains-promise-to-reduce-salt-and-fat-14217109.html|access-date=11 February 2011|newspaper=Belfast Telegraph|date=7 March 2009}}</ref> Due to this, low-fat mayonnaise is a common substitute along with low salt bread and less fatty bacon. A more visible solution is to use [[turkey bacon]] in lieu of normal bacon.<ref name="prevent">{{cite book|last=Bricklin |first=Mark |title=Prevention Magazine's Nutrition Advisor: The Ultimate Guide to the Health-Boosting and Health-Harming Factors in Your Diet |year=1994 |publisher=Rodale |isbn=0-87596-225-4 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iPFokL0MuswC&q=BLT+bacon&pg=PA454 |page=454}}</ref> One of the variations on the BLT is the [[club sandwich]], a two-layered sandwich in which one layer is a BLT. The other layer can be almost any sort of sliced meat, normally chicken or turkey.<ref>{{cite book|last=Civitello|first=Linda|title=Cuisine and culture: a history of food and people|year=2007|publisher=John Wiley and Sons|isbn=978-0-471-74172-5|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MBRBjBTEBHYC&q=BLT+club+differences&pg=PA180|page=180}}</ref>
The sandwich has a high sodium and fat content, and has been specifically targeted by UK café chains in an effort to reduce salt and fat.<ref>{{cite news|title=Cafe chains promise to reduce salt and fat|url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/news/health/cafe-chains-promise-to-reduce-salt-and-fat-14217109.html|access-date=11 February 2011|newspaper=Belfast Telegraph|date=7 March 2009}}</ref> Due to this, low-fat mayonnaise is a common substitute along with low salt bread and less fatty bacon. A more visible solution is to use [[turkey bacon]] in lieu of normal bacon.<ref name="prevent">{{cite book|last=Bricklin |first=Mark |title=Prevention Magazine's Nutrition Advisor: The Ultimate Guide to the Health-Boosting and Health-Harming Factors in Your Diet |year=1994 |publisher=Rodale |isbn=0-87596-225-4 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iPFokL0MuswC&q=BLT+bacon&pg=PA454 |page=454}}</ref> One of the variations on the BLT is the [https://culinaryisart.com/club-sandwich-recipe/ club sandwich], a two-layered sandwich in which one layer is a BLT. The other layer can be almost any sort of sliced meat, normally chicken or turkey.<ref>{{cite book|last=Civitello|first=Linda|title=Cuisine and culture: a history of food and people|year=2007|publisher=John Wiley and Sons|isbn=978-0-471-74172-5|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MBRBjBTEBHYC&q=BLT+club+differences&pg=PA180|page=180}}</ref>

Line 9: Line 9:
Antigens are recognized by antigen receptors, including antibodies and T-cell receptors.<ref name=clev/> Diverse antigen receptors are made by cells of the immune system so that each cell has a specificity for a single antigen.<ref name=clev/> Upon exposure to an antigen, only the lymphocytes that recognize that antigen are activated and expanded, a process known as [[clonal selection]].<ref name=Abbas/> In most cases, antibodies are ''antigen-specific'', meaning that an antibody can only react to and bind one specific antigen; in some instances, however, antibodies may [[cross-reactivity|cross-react]] to bind more than one antigen. The reaction between an antigen and an antibody is called the [[antigen-antibody reaction]].
Antigens are recognized by antigen receptors, including antibodies and T-cell receptors.<ref name=clev/> Diverse antigen receptors are made by cells of the immune system so that each cell has a specificity for a single antigen.<ref name=clev/> Upon exposure to an antigen, only the lymphocytes that recognize that antigen are activated and expanded, a process known as [[clonal selection]].<ref name=Abbas/> In most cases, antibodies are ''antigen-specific'', meaning that an antibody can only react to and bind one specific antigen; in some instances, however, antibodies may [[cross-reactivity|cross-react]] to bind more than one antigen. The reaction between an antigen and an antibody is called the [[antigen-antibody reaction]].


Antigen can also originate from within the body ("[[self-protein]]" or "self antigens") or from the external environment ("non-self").<ref name=mlp/> The immune system identifies and attacks "non-self" external antigens. Antibodies usually do not react with self-antigens due to [[central tolerance|negative selection]] of [[T cell]]s in the [[thymus]] and [[B cell]]s in the [[bone marrow]].<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Gallucci S, Lolkema M, Matzinger P | title = Natural adjuvants: endogenous activators of dendritic cells | journal = Nature Medicine | volume = 5 | issue = 11 | pages = 1249–1255 | date = November 1999 | pmid = 10545990 | doi = 10.1038/15200 | s2cid = 29090284 }}</ref> The diseases in which antibodies react with self antigens and damage the body's own cells are called [[autoimmune disease]]s.<ref>{{cite book | vauthors = Janeway Jr CA, Travers P, Walport M, Shlomchik MJ |date=2001 |chapter=Autoimmune responses are directed against self antigens |chapter-url=https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK27155/ |title=Immunobiology: The Immune System in Health and Disease. |publisher=Elsevier España | edition = 5th |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=KoHxpimwSWUC |oclc=45708106 |isbn=9780815336426}}</ref>
Antigen can originate either from within the body ("[[self-protein]]" or "self antigens") or from the external environment ("non-self").<ref name=mlp/> The immune system identifies and attacks "non-self" external antigens. Antibodies usually do not react with self-antigens due to [[central tolerance|negative selection]] of [[T cell]]s in the [[thymus]] and [[B cell]]s in the [[bone marrow]].<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Gallucci S, Lolkema M, Matzinger P | title = Natural adjuvants: endogenous activators of dendritic cells | journal = Nature Medicine | volume = 5 | issue = 11 | pages = 1249–1255 | date = November 1999 | pmid = 10545990 | doi = 10.1038/15200 | s2cid = 29090284 }}</ref> The diseases in which antibodies react with self antigens and damage the body's own cells are called [[autoimmune disease]]s.<ref>{{cite book | vauthors = Janeway Jr CA, Travers P, Walport M, Shlomchik MJ |date=2001 |chapter=Autoimmune responses are directed against self antigens |chapter-url=https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK27155/ |title=Immunobiology: The Immune System in Health and Disease. |publisher=Elsevier España | edition = 5th |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=KoHxpimwSWUC |oclc=45708106 |isbn=9780815336426}}</ref>


[[Vaccine]]s are examples of antigens in an immunogenic form, which are intentionally administered to a recipient to induce the memory function of the [[adaptive immune system]] towards antigens of the pathogen invading that recipient. The vaccine for [[seasonal influenza]] is a common example.<ref name="cdc">{{cite web |title=Antigenic characterization |url=https://www.cdc.gov/flu/about/professionals/antigenic.htm |publisher=US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention |access-date=13 October 2020 |date=15 October 2019}}</ref>

name: User:Mangoozn
info:

←Created page with 'Clothing in India changes depending on the different ethnicity, geography, climate, and cultural traditions of the people of each region of India. The clothing in India also encompasses the wide variety of Indian embroidery, prints, handwork, embellishment, styles of wearing cloths. India is known for its diversity the all over the globe. Ethnic clothing is just one of the things that distinguish one part of India from the other. The craftsmanship with whi...'

New page

Clothing in India changes depending on the different ethnicity, geography, climate, and cultural traditions of the people of each region of India. The clothing in India also encompasses the wide variety of Indian embroidery, prints, handwork, embellishment, styles of wearing cloths.

India is known for its diversity the all over the globe. Ethnic clothing is just one of the things that distinguish one part of India from the other. The craftsmanship with which artisans create traditional dresses is really incredible. All forms of clothing are quite labor intensive and require a lot of attention to detail. Many of these art forms are dying because the cost of production is higher and few people can afford to pay the high cost of the dress. As every state in India is geographically different from the other, this has given rise to varied kinds of dresses and styles. The Saree is one Indian dress that enjoys worldwide popularity. Artisans across the country make use of locally available resources to produce sarees, which are a masterpiece in their own self. The beautiful weaves and designs on sarees makes one wonder about the creativity of these weavers. Different regions of India have different specialty and variety of sarees.

Founded in 1986 and Mangoozn.in born in 2012 as a lifestyle fashion brand that makes creative, distinctive fashion for the trendy, contemporary Indian. Mangoozn.in online platform was created to have an impact on Men, Women and Kid dressing through innovation, honesty and thoughtfulness.

All our products are handpicked and sourced from multiple designers and manufacturers across India. We like to experiment freely, which allows us to balance creativity and reliability, and our innovative designs. Our innovation focus extends to our operations as well. We are vertically integrated, and have our own designers who manufacture our own products, and we cut out the middleman wherever possible. This direct-to-consumer model allows us to create high-quality fashion at affordable prices.

name: New comment by amiga386 in ""
info:
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37335219

The article doesn't say there are crimes on KF, only that KF "provides a forum for gamifying abuse and doxxing". Magically, that abuse just happens without any planning of it appearing on KF, and then KF's users gossip about the results openly. The article says it supports prosecuting those missing-link people for crimes: "we fully support criminal and civil liability for those who abuse and harass others"

It does think companies should act on illegal speech; those "companies" are the people/orgs who run websites, like KF. "We should enact strong data privacy laws that target, among others, the data brokers whose services help enable doxxing". The EFF doesn't think other companies (network carriers, etc.) should act on illegal speech.

The government ought to take a more active role! Would you prefer the courts to affirm your legal rights, or for an oligopoly of private companies to brazenly deny you them, with no recourse?

name: New comment by thriftwy in ""
info:
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37335214

That is actually a great question.

There is USA, there is Canada which has never declared independence, and I can't say outright that Canada is a worse country than USA, or has less self-determination, after taking population and geography into account.

The same question about the French Revolution. Yes, they have no choice but praise it now, but Britain had no revolution and we are all now writing in English. Has France averted Revolution, it is likely that we would all be writing in French now, and English would be a niche language of England and some very backwards African ex-colonies. Was it worth it? Sure, French Revolution lead to Napoleon, who could be a success had he not jump under the Russian steamroller.

The best thing about revolutions is not having them and waiting for a bigger sucker to have one. The benefits of somebody out there having a revolution seem to be shared, whereas the cost seems to be footed by the ones who did it to their country.

This is maybe the impatience of youth running up against the certaintly of middle age.

I think the reality is that both sides have good points. Nuclear looks like the only way to create enough energy density to power modern societies. name: New comment by piva00 in "It's not just you – no one is posting on social media anymore"
info:
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37335209

I feel this misses just one adjective: "nobody interesting comes here anymore, it's too crowded". A similar feeling I get from overtouristed places, initially they are interesting because of some attraction: the nightlife, the art scene, the food scene, or any combination of these (and other factors I'm too lazy to list) with some quirkiness that attracts people who are interested in the twist. Over time it becomes attractive to more people because they hear about it from others who experienced it, then it goes downhill where people will flock to a place but nothing that made it initially interesting is there anymore, it just becomes a self-perpetuating meme.

It feels it's a pattern that develops in social media, tourism, products, etc., something fresh appears which gets overextended and bores us out in the end, the laggards missed the magic. Rinse and repeat.

name: New comment by sph in "Young climate activist tells Greenpeace to drop ‘old-fashioned’ anti-nuclear"
info:
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37335208

We had nuclear power in Italy. From my house, I could see the cooling towers of the abandoned nuclear power plant in Trino [1] in the distance.

There was a referendum in November 1987 asking whether to abolish any form of nuclear power. It won with 80% of yes votes. This was a year after the Chernobyl disaster. Over the next few decades, Italy started to import electricity at a premium, mostly from its French neighbour, which has never stopped investing on nuclear and is today Europe's largest electricity exporter.

In June 2011 there was a new referendum, asking whether to revive plans nuclear power. It failed with 94% of No votes. This was 3 months after the Fukushima nuclear disaster.

I do not trust politicians, nor anti-nuclear activists, to ever do the right thing and drop their outdated stance on the matter.

--

1: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enrico_Fermi_Nuclear_Power_Pla...

name: New comment by ben_w in "It's not just you – no one is posting on social media anymore"
info:
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37335206

My understanding is that enshittification is much more general (though perhaps this is just linguistic drift); an organisation that has done a hard thing, but now has to justify its continuing existence and expense coming up with things nobody needs and which add zero or negative value.

This can be rent extraction (literal or metaphorical, no matter where on that spectrum advertising goes); and also it can be feature creep, mission creep, scope creep, bureaucratic bloat.

name: New comment by jacquesm in "The Tera Computer System (1990)"
info:
https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37335205

Any von Neumann inspired architecture is going to resemble looking at your data through a keyhole and trying to cram as much data through that keyhole as you can. There is an obvious solution to that but unfortunately it does not generalize well and it would likely be very hard to program for. This bottle-neck is what we spend a very large fraction of our time dealing with. Crack that one and you will be more famous than Bill Gates. I've seen some really nice attempts at computing fabrics but none that were able to grab any kind of market share, there was a post the other day about another Barrel Processor (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=37315802) which is probably why this one is posted now. But Barrel processors are still limited by the die size and need regular processors to deal with the non parallelizable parts of the code, they're a different point on the general cpu <-> specialized hardware continuum that works well for certain problems.

Chances are that as we get closer to the limits of Moore's law that we will see a revival of such exotic architectures because they will be the only way forward to get more computing power. Especially workloads like AI and graph analysis could well benefit from this because the hardware and the data model overlap quite nicely.

Line 29: Line 29:


==History==
==History==
Although the structure was conceived in 1846 during the reign of King [[Nangklao|(Rama III)]] it was not completed during his reign. Several attempts were made by King Rama III's successor to complete it but it was never successful. It was only in 1960 under [[Bhumibol Adulyadej|Rama IX]] construction was restarted. It was supervised by the [[Fine Arts Department|Fine Arts Department of Thailand]]. In 1995 a [[Relics associated with Buddha|Buddha relic]] was enshrined at the topmost spire of the Loha Parsat. In 2007 it was opened to public.
Although the structure was conceived in 1846 during the reign of King [[Nangklao|(Rama III)]] it was not completed during his reign. Several attempts were made by King Rama III's successor to complete it but it was never successful. It was only in 1960 under [[Bhumibol Adulyadej|Rama IX]] construction was restarted. It was supervised by the [[Fine Arts Department|Fine Arts Department of Thailand]]. In 1995 a [[Relics associated with Buddha|Buddha relic]] was enshrined at the topmost spire of the Loha Parsat.
